abstract: Jeff Sommer Strategies column observes Starbucks has increased prices of its beverages even as coffee prices have fallen globally on commodities markets; notes apparent disconnect is due to fact that company buys large quantities of coffee at set prices in advance and coffee accounts for only 10 percent of its overall costs.
lead_paragraph: The company’s strategy has created an odd situation this summer: It has increased retail prices for brewed coffee just as coffee prices on world commodities markets have fallen.

headline.main: Why Starbucks Prices Went Up as Coffee Beans Got Cheaper
headline.print_headline: Cheap Coffee and the Starbucks Premium

snippet: The company’s strategy has created an odd situation this summer: It has increased retail prices for brewed coffee just as coffee prices on world commodities markets have fallen.
